Tucson nodds.  Yet there was still so much he didn't know and wanted to lea=
rn. There was also the question of his roots.  He knew he could sense somet=
hing but was not quite sure of them.

"I completely understand your reserve=
s my friends.  And I will hold nothing against you for them.  Yet all I ask=
 is that you give Perceptor the chance to prove himself.  In due time, he w=
ill do just that."

He listens to his vocalizer.  Rat Trap looks up to him =
as if now knowing something.  Straight Shot too, appears highly curious and=
 looks to Rat Trap.

" Am I hearing things, or does Tucson's voice sound ve=
ry, very familliar?"

Rat Trap looks up to Tucson and then to Legacy and Ro=
dimus.

"She's right, your voice, Wheels, your voice, do you realize who yo=
u sounded like just then?"

Tucson shrugs.

" Not really sure where you're =
going with that Rat Trap."

Straight Shot looks to him.

" I know who it so=
unds like.  We only knew Optimus for a short time, but I can't mistake his =
voice and you most certainly sound like him."

Tucson shows modesty in his =
expression.

" Maybe it's just a cooincedence."

Rat Trap looks to him inte=
ntly.

" Legacy, You know a lot about everyone, don't ya think Wheels sound=
s a lot like Optimus?  And by chance, could he actually be related to him?"=

> Bump nodded as he opened a storage closet and pulled out a lar=
ge
> panel. Pushing a few buttons on it it began to glow slightly as it
> u=
nfolded into a temporary antigravity suspensor bed.
> 
> "I will be right b=
ack." he said, "I am going to retrieve Nightlight.
> We still have a bit of=
 work to do it seems."
> 
> > <OLD>
> >
> > Tucson nodds.
> >
> > "Thank yo=
u Legacy, everyone, I know it's hard to understand things that we normally =
could never understand, but it is this common ground which will keep us tog=
ether as a faction, something Hydras does not have, nor will ever have. I a=
lso understand your reservations on the matter. I can tell just by the tone=
s of your voices, but I also comprehend the reason behind it and it's only =
normal to have reservations. I am not offended by your true feelings, but t=
hankful you are willing to give Perceptor the chance to prove himself worth=
y."
> >
> > Before Tucson had been upgraded to a Prime, this sort of talk w=
ould often anger him to the point of grave annoyance. He'd often speak up a=
nd stick up for those being riddiculed and whenever necesary, he probably w=
ould have lost his temper all together and decked the offender right there =
and then. But now, he realizes those feelings did not come through. Somethi=
ng was definitely changing. Instead of being his old self, he was evolving =
into someone new, wiser, more tolerant, and a lot more calm as an individua=
l. Yet, his toughness was still there, along with his courage, and will to =
fight. He could not yet understand the meaning of these changes, and for wh=
atever reason, he knew they were for the better. He now turns his head in L=
egacy's direction.
> >
> > " Even as a Prime, I'm still in the process of l=
earning. I don't think I'll ever stop learning. One thing I have to admit, =
if I were still my old self now, short tempered, quick to be critical, I ma=
y have blown the roof off the Ark, and retorted adversely. But now, I could=
n't find it in my spark to react as such. I'm changing, and as I change, I =
can feel the pressense of Optimus Prime. I often feel that if I could see m=
y shadow, it would appear as his once did, long ago. Why is that? I know I'=
m not Optimus, yet there is a part of me that feels that he's within me som=
ehow. Legacy, is there something about me that even I do not know? I'm very=
 curious to find out."
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> Legacy watched Tuscon impassively, h=
is single optic glowing with a
> focused light. "Your reaction is . . . cur=
ious." Legacy said in his
> normal icy tones, "Change is inevitable,  predi=
ctable and often times
> beneficial. Logic demands that we adapt to what we=
 cannot control and
> be a part of change rather than a victim of it."
> 
>=
 Legacy turned to observe Perceptor, "I am sure we shall all keep a
> watch=
ful optic on him, and adapt our responses to his actions."
> 
> Santon nodd=
ed as he crossed his arms, "Yep. I agree. If you vouch for
> him Tuscon the=
n I will give him the benefit of the doubt, but I won't
> take my optic off=
 of him until he proves it to me he's trust worthy."
> 
> Torca, who had st=
epped back in the room merely nodded at Tuscon,
> holding his own council f=
or the moment on how he felt about
> Perceptor's presence. Instead he chose=
 to change the subject, "I will
> be sending the Fuzors out on patrol. Ther=
e is no telling what Hydras
> is doing while we are all sitting here watchi=
ng you and Rodimus
> recover."
